byline.contributor: Ahmad Shakib contributed reporting from Kabul, and Najim Rahim from Kunduz, Afghanistan.
byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN

abstract: Family members of deceased Najibullah Momand, janitor who worked at Doctors Without Borders hospital in Kunduz, Afghanistan, reminiscent fondly about young father of two little children; Momand died along with at least dozen other hospital employees when American military forces hit medical facility in October.
lead_paragraph: Najibullah Momand, who worked as a janitor at the Doctors Without Borders hospital in Kunduz, Afghanistan, was one of at least a dozen staff members who died in the recent attacks on the hospital.

headline.main: Afghan Family Remembers a Loving Son Killed in Airstrike on Kunduz Hospital
headline.print_headline: Afghan Family Remembers a Son Killed in Hospital Airstrike

snippet: Najibullah Momand, who worked as a janitor at the Doctors Without Borders hospital in Kunduz, Afghanistan, was one of at least a dozen staff members who died in the recent attacks on the hospital.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
